bibl.title: Letter from David L. Edsall to Jefferson Randolph Kean, January 12, 1925

div1.p: Edsall thanks Kean for identifying Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from David L. Edsall to Jefferson Randolph Kean, January 12, 1925
div1.opener:
HARVARD UNIVERSITY
MEDICAL SCHOOL
Boston 17, Massachusetts
January 12, 1925
DAVID L. EDSALL, M.D.
Dean
WORTH HALE, M.D.
Assistant Dean
II
Assoc'n Military Surgeons, U.S.
JAN 14 1925
Secretary-Treasurer's Office.
Colonel J. R. Kean, U.S. Army, Retired,
Army Medical Museum,
Washington, D. C.
My dear Colonel Kean:
div1.p:
I am exceedingly grateful to you for all the trouble
you have taken about identifying John R. Kissinger. Your
assistance has made the present status of our fund perfectly
clear.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, David L. Edsall
Dean R:MM
